column2: Your journey to emulate [Root.GetEmulatedTzar] have flourished reccently. People started to notice your development, and you got some compliments from some [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle]s too.
I'm a better [Root.GetManWoman] now.
I won't stop here!
Finally, your efforts have paid off. You live like [Root.GetEmulatedTzar] in [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName], nobody, peasant, noble or [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle] could doubt that.
[Root.GetEmulatedTzarHeSheCap] must be smiling up there.
But I can show even more!
In the past few days, you hear laughters behind your back, and you kwo why. You tried everything, but it seems like you failed to emulate [Root.GetEmulatedTzar].
I guess I have a different path.
I just need a little more time.
The past year was uneventful regarding your efforts to emulate [Root.GetEmulatedTzar].
Just go on.
I shall focus on something else.
Emulate Peter the Greatest
Emulate Nicholas the Passion-Bearer
Emulate Ivan the Formidable

[This.GetTitledFirstName] tries to live according to the ways of Peter the Greatest. [This.GetSheHeCap] focuses on becoming §YDiligent§!, §YHonest§! and §YCruel§!, while avoiding their opposites.

[This.GetTitledFirstName] tries to live according to the ways of Nicholas the Passion-Bearer. [This.GetSheHeCap] focuses on becoming §YContent§!, §YTemperate§! and §YHumble§!, while avoiding their opposites.
[This.GetTitledFirstName] tries to live according to the ways of Ivan the Formidable. [This.GetSheHeCap] focuses on becoming §YCruel§!, §YWroth§! and §YParanoid§!, while avoiding their opposites.

[This.GetTitledFirstName] tries to live according to the ways of Catherine the Tzarina. [This.GetSheHeCap] focuses on becoming §YAmbitious§!, §YLustful§! and §YDeceitful§!, while avoiding their opposites.
[This.GetTitledFirstName] tries to live according to the ways of Alexander the Liberator. [This.GetSheHeCap] focuses on becoming §YJust§!, §YKind§! and §YStubborn§!, while avoiding their opposites.

[This.GetTitledFirstName] tries to live according to the ways of Alexis the Quietest. [This.GetSheHeCap] focuses on becoming §YGregarious§!, §YTrusting§! and §YZealous§!, while avoiding their opposites.

Gained a trait of the emulated or lost its opposite.

You have been in the library more and more often. You can't stop reading books about how to become a better [Root.Religion.GetName]. But this happens to reduce the time you spend with other important issues.
Knowledge is the only thing that matters.
I will take a break.
You have already tried many strange things to improve yourself as a [Root.Religion.GetName]. None of them helped. Today someone mentioned another one. You could wear a cilice.
Painful, but effective.
This torture is for the fools.
Your reccent decision to [Root.GetEmulationAction] wasn't left unnoticed. [event_target:emulation_likes.GetTitledFirstName] complimented your behavior multiple times.
We could speak more.
I'm doing this for the faith.

Your reccent decision to [Root.GetEmulationAction] wasn't left unnoticed. [event_target:emulation_dislikes.GetTitledFirstName] told many of the other courtiers that this isn't the right behavior for a [Root.GetTitle].
[emulation_dislikes.GetSheHeCap] should stop.
I won't embarrass myself like this.
Wears cicile
This character follows a truelly hurtful religious practice.
Spends time studying
This person spends a bit too much time in the library.
Getting better results during the §YEmulate [From.GetEmulatedTzar]§! ambition.

Today an old man requested visit from you. He explained that he was a truely religious person, but also a poor one. He wants to sell you a portrait of [Root.GetEmulatedTzar] that is his only possession.
I will buy it for myself.
I will buy it for the local church.
Nobody have seen him coming in, right?
I have to decline.
